Authors: Surhajito S., Jimmy J., Girsang A.S.
Title: Mobile decision support system to determine Toddler's nutrition using fuzzy sugeno
Source title: International Journal of Electrical and Computer Engineering
Affiliations: Binus Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Surhajito, S., Binus Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Jimmy, J., Binus Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Binus Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Determination of nutritional status is closely related to the determination of dietary patterns should be given to infants. Nutrition is very important role in mental, physical development, and human productivity. In this study, the system based on android is developed to determine the nutritional status of infants by using Fuzzy Sugeno. Indicator variables are age, height, circle head, and body weight according to the male or female. In this study, the results of measurements of nutritional status of children with Fuzzy Sugenoare tested by comparing the nutritional quality of the data Posyandu toddler by using anthropometric tables. The results of the evaluation measurement accuracy in this application are compared with the results of manual calculation based infant growth charts according to WHO standards. Therefore, these applications can be used to help the community in monitoring the nutritional status of children so that the growth of children is more appropriate in line with expectations. Author Keywords: Basic4android; Method fuzzy sugeno; SQL lite manager; Toddler's nutrition status
References: Muljono, (2011) Using Fuzzy Sugeno Method to Determine Toddler's Nutrition Status.
